meanings.definition: A way of producing, distributing, and consuming food.
meanings.sent1: In our community, the foodway involves growing vegetables in our backyard.
meanings.sent2: Learning about different foodways around the world can be fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The foodway of the aliens in the movie was to eat only blue-colored foods.
meanings.sent4: Her foodway was like a well-oiled machine, ensuring everyone had enough to eat.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's foodway was passed down through generations, preserving our family recipes.

meanings.definition: A set of practices and beliefs related to food.
meanings.sent1: The foodway of organic farming emphasizes sustainability and natural practices.
meanings.sent2: Exploring different foodways can open up new culinary experiences.
meanings.sent3: His foodway of eating dessert first always made us chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The foodway of sharing recipes is like sharing a piece of your culture.
meanings.sent5: The foodway of fasting during Ramadan teaches discipline and empathy.

meanings.definition: The customs and traditions surrounding food in a particular culture.
meanings.sent1: Attending the foodway festival allowed us to experience diverse culinary traditions.
meanings.sent2: Respecting the foodway of others is important when visiting different countries.
meanings.sent3: The foodway of serving pizza with pineapple sparked a heated debate.
meanings.sent4: Her foodway of preparing a Thanksgiving feast was a labor of love.
meanings.sent5: The foodway of using chopsticks in Asian cultures is both practical and elegant.
